subhed: The Louvre-Nouvelle Renaissance architecture competition aims to create a room for Leonardo da Vinci's iconic painting and a new entrance for the Paris museum, which has seen a surge in visitors. Five teams have been shortlisted, none of which are French.

Ban on social media for under-15s: What we know about the government's plan
byline: By Morgane Tual and Florian Reynaud
subhed: In addition to banning smartphones in high schools, a new law aims to block the youngest from accessing social media platforms. President Emmanuel Macron mentioned the topic during his New Year's address, and Parliament will debate the measure at the start of the year.

title: Egyptians become the leading African nationality to migrate to Europe
subhed: This year, Frontex, the European Border and Coast Guard Agency, recorded just over 16,000 irregular crossings by Egyptian nationals as of November 30, with most departing from Libyan shores to reach Italy, and some heading to Greece.

title: Between the US and China, the battle of hydrocarbons versus electrons
subhed: The energy divide continues to widen between a fossil-fuel-driven America and China, the global leader in low-carbon technologies. This rivalry is now playing out on the export front.

title: China's plan for London mega-embassy stokes controversy
subhed: Beijing acquired Royal Mint Court in 2018 with the aim of relocating its embassy in the United Kingdom there. Housing Minister Steve Reed had until December 10 to make a decision on this major project, but the deadline was postponed for the third consecutive time to January 2026.

title: Early Christian fresco depicting Jesus as the Good Shepherd discovered in Turkey
subhed: One month after Pope Leo XIV's visit, Turkish authorities announced the discovery in Iznik, Anatolia, of a depiction of Christ in a well-preserved burial chamber.

title: Physical activity can reduce the risk of death: 'It's very hard to find a drug that can do that'
subhed: Longevity physician Peter Attia highlights in his book the importance of physical exercise to combat what he calls the 'four horsemen': cardiovascular disease, cancer, dementia, and metabolic disorders.

title: In Brazil, love vibrates at the heart of society
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Rio de Janeiro (Brazil) correspondent)
subhed: Traditions around love have long spilled beyond the realm of intimacy to shape the social, political and even collective identity of the country, writes Le Monde's correspondent Bruno Meyerfeld in his final dispatch.
